Container.Name: CrashPlan
Container.Overview: CrashPlan makes it easy to protect your digital life, so you can get back to what’s important in real life. Only CrashPlan offers totally free local and offsite backup. A subscription to the cloud backup service gets you continuous backup, mobile file access and lots more. For the ultimate in computer backup, get all three, from the same easy application. [br][br] The graphical user interface (GUI) is accessible through a modern web browser or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (about 160MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-crashplan/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-crashplan/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Warning:[/b][/span] Make sure to read the [i]Taking Over Existing Backup[/i] section from the documentation if you are installing this container to replace another CrashPlan installation (from Windows, Linux, Mac or even another Docker container).

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br> Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This is where files and folders to backup are located.<br> Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Flash
Config.Description: This is where data on your unRAID flash device is located. Useful to backup your unRAID configuration.<br> Container path: /flash

Config.Name: Inbound Backup Directory
Display Width
Config.Description: Width, in pixels, of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height, in pixels, of the application's window.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of −20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br> <b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Maximum Memory
Config.Description: Maximum amount of memory the CrashPlan Engine is allowed to use. Format of the value is <i><b>size[g∣G∣m∣M∣k∣K]</b></i>. By default, when this variable is not set, a maximum of 1024MB of memory is allowed.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI with a web browser.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI with VNC client.<br> Make sure this port is equal to the WEB GUI port + 100.

Config.Name: Computer-to-Computer Backup Port
